title: Poynor's Points: Adversity
content:
Adversity 
  
I’ve been a part of a lot of football games. There hasn’t been a single game that something bad didn’t happen to us somewhere along the way. Whether it was a turnover, tipped ball, bad call, or whatever the case may be something bad is always going to happen. We try to teach our kids it’s not what happens to you that is the most important; it’s how you handle the situation that is the most important. I believe that is a great lesson for life. We are all going to have some bad things happen to us. Some are going to have more adversity than others. But it is still the way we handle those tough situations that counts. We had some adversity for this first home game. The construction project has not finished on time. We just had to make due with the situation that we were presented with.
